inference:
$\angle BAC = 46^\circ$ and $\angle ABC = 71^\circ$.
In $\triangle ABC$, $\angle ACB = 180^\circ - (\angle BAC + \angle ABC) = 180^\circ - (46^\circ + 71^\circ) = 180^\circ - 117^\circ = 63^\circ$.
$\angle ADC = 90^\circ$, $\angle AEB = 90^\circ$.
In quadrilateral $AEHD$, $\angle DAH + \angle AEH + \angle HDE + \angle DEH = 360^\circ$.
$\angle DAH = 90^\circ - \angle CAD$, $\angle AEH = 90^\circ - \angle EAB$.
$\angle ADC = \angle AEB = 90^\circ$.
Quadrilateral $CEHD$ is cyclic, so $\angle CEH + \angle CDH = 180^\circ$.
$\angle CEH = \angle C + \angle EAB$ (exterior angle of $\triangle ABE$).
$\angle BHE = 180^\circ - \angle AHB = \angle C$.
In quadrilateral $AEHB$, $\angle AHB = 180^\circ - \angle ABE$.
In $\triangle AHB$, $\angle AHB + \angle HAB + \angle HBA = 180^\circ$.
In $\triangle AHB$, $\angle AHB = 180^\circ - (\angle HAB + \angle HBA)$.
$\angle HAB = 90^\circ - \angle C$.
$\angle HBA = 90^\circ - \angle C$.
$\angle AHB = 180^\circ - (90^\circ - \angle ACB + 90^\circ - \angle ABC) = 180^\circ - (90^\circ - 63^\circ + 90^\circ - 71^\circ) = 180^\circ - (27^\circ + 19^\circ) = 180^\circ - 46^\circ = 134^\circ$.
$\angle AHB = 180^\circ - \angle DHE = 180^\circ - (\angle CAD + \angle CBE) = 180^\circ - (90^\circ - (90^\circ - \angle BAC) + 90^\circ - \angle ABC)$.
In quadrilateral $AEHB$, $\angle AHB + \angle AEB + \angle CBE + \angle EAB = 360^\circ$.
In $\triangle AHB$, $\angle AHB + \angle HAB + \angle HBA = 180^\circ$.
$\angle AHB + (90^\circ - \angle C) + (90^\circ - \angle B) = 180^\circ$.
$\angle AHB = 180^\circ - (90^\circ - 63^\circ) - (90^\circ - 71^\circ) = 180^\circ - 27^\circ - 19^\circ = 180^\circ - 46^\circ = 134^\circ$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{134}$

inference:
Let $ABC$ be a triangle with $\angle BAC = 46^\circ$ and $\angle ABC = 71^\circ$.
Then $\angle ACB = 180^\circ - (46^\circ + 71^\circ) = 63^\circ$.
Let $AE \perp BC$ and $AD \perp BC$.  The problem states that $\angle ADC = 90^\circ$ and $\angle AEB = 90^\circ$.

In $\triangle AHB$, $\angle AHB + \angle HAB + \angle HBA = 180^\circ$.
We have $\angle HAB = 90^\circ - \angle ACB = 90^\circ - 63^\circ = 27^\circ$, and
$\angle HBA = 90^\circ - \angle ABC = 90^\circ - 71^\circ = 19^\circ$.
Thus, $\angle AHB = 180^\circ - (27^\circ + 19^\circ) = 180^\circ - 46^\circ = 134^\circ$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{134}$
